author: news@plymouthherald.co.uk (Isabella Marsans, Daniel Clark)
title: Watch Royal Navy frigate HMS Richmond shoot down two drones over Red Sea in dramatic video
text: This is the dramatic moment a Plymouth-based Royal Navy warship shot down two Houthi attack drones in the Red Sea. Defence Secretary Grant Shapps said the incident overnight saw HMS Richmond use its Sea Ceptor missiles to repel the attack. US Central Command reported that 15 drones in total were brought down by group vessels and planes during assaults in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden early on Saturday. A video, released by the Ministry of Defence, shows flashes of light as the missiles are launched into the air at the Houthi attack drones. Defence Secretary Grant Shapps said: "The UK and our allies will continue to take the action necessary to save lives and protect freedom of navigation." Confirmation came from the [Ministry of Defence](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/all-about/ministry-of-defence) that the Type 23 frigate jointly with international allies, "fully repelled" a Houthi drone attack, fortunately resulting in no injuries or damage, reports [the Express](https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/1875651/hms-richmond-houthi-drones-Red-Sea). Read More [First official picture released of Princess of Wales since undergoing serious abdominal surgery](https://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/kate-middleton-breaks-silence-thanks-9154246) The crew of HMS Richmond were praised by the MoD for their "exemplary manner", restating the UK's firm stance that we will act as needed to shield innocent lives and the world economy. Despite having little or no ties to Israel, the Houthis, originating from Yemen, have explained their attacks on shipping in the Red Sea as a reaction to happenings in Gaza. These attacks on vessels travelling through the Red Sea have led to ships rerouting around southern Africa instead of using the Suez Canal between Europe and Asia, increasing costs and posing a potential risk to the global economy. The UK sent HMS Richmond to the Red Sea at the start of January. HMS Diamond and HMS Lancaster were already in the region to the region to protect container ships from assaults by the Houthis. The warship is part of a US-led coalition named Operation Prosperity Guardian, which has been protecting trade ships as they journey through the region and towards the Suez Canal and Europe. At the time, Shapps told MPs that HMS Richmond, a type 23 frigate, would be posted to protect merchant vessels - but stressed the warship is only being deployed to the Gulf to replace a British vessel already on patrol there. Join PlymouthLive's WhatsApp community for top stories and breaking news sent directly to your phone [PlymouthLive is now on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/G4cCswwb4IJIabxkM1iJ35 \u0009\u0009\u0009) and we want you to join us. Once you sign up for our updates, we'll send the latest breaking news and biggest stories of the day straight to your phone. To join our community, you need to already have WhatsApp. All you need to do is click this link and select 'Join Community'. No one will be able to see who is signed up and no one can send messages except the PlymouthLive team. We also treat our community members to special offers, promotions, and adverts from us and our partners. If you don't like our community, you can check out any time you like. author: Jenny Kang
title: Lee Chaeyeon Reveals Agonizing MRI Scanâ€”Says She Won't Be Dancing For A While - Koreaboo
text:
Former IZ*ONE member turned soloist Lee Chaeyeon will be going on a â€œdance hiatus,â€ so it seems.
Lee Chaeyeon | @chaestival_/Instagram In a series of Instagram updates, the soloist revealed the state of her herniated discsâ€¦
| @chaestival_/Instagram Letâ€™s stay together, friendsâ€¦ Please be good.
â€” Chaeyeon
â€¦and commented that she wonâ€™t be pushing herself to dance for a while.
| @chaestival_/Instagram Itâ€™s a wonder how they didnâ€™t herniate before. They put in some work.
â€” Chaeyeon
| @chaestival_/Instagram No more warming up like this. Althoughâ€¦ That does feel really good.
â€” Chaeyeon
While Chaeyeon promised to get right back to it â€œin the new yearâ€¦â€
| @chaestival_/Instagram Closedâ€¦ as in I wonâ€™t be dancing for a while, or whatever. Iâ€™ll be back on track by next year!
â€” Chaeyeon
â€¦fans remain concerned for her, given her set schedule with SBS â€˜s Shooting Stars (also known as Kick A Goal )â€”a show in which the soloist plays soccer, and are wishing her a restful time.
| theqoo â€œTake care, Chaeyeon, I love watching you danceâ€¦ Wishing you a full recovery so you can keep on dancing!â€ â€œMy favorite idols all have herniated discs, tooâ€¦ So I feel for her. It must be so painful.â€ â€œOh, noâ€¦ Take care of yourself!â€ â€œGosh, that looks painful as heck.â€ â€œHerniated discs and dancers go together hand-in-hand. That must be so painful.â€ Source: theqoo

author: Annie Lane | dearannie@creators.com
title: Dear Annie: My wife is addicted to pain meds and Iâ€™m considering divorce - mlive.com
text:
Dear Annie: My wife has been on pain medication for almost a decade, and it has turned into a serious addiction. I have to monitor her pills weekly -- though, recently, itâ€™s been daily. She hasnâ€™t worked at all the last decade, ever since she started getting prescribed the painkillers. She lays in bed all day long, sleeping or watching TV. Iâ€™ve bought several safes to lock away her pills in so that I can only administer to her what she needs. Sheâ€™s broken into all of them. I keep the pills with me at all times so that I can make sure she doesnâ€™t take too much. Sheâ€™s constantly deriding me, blaming me for her not having enough pills. She always pleads, â€œJust give me tomorrowâ€™s pills tonight.â€ She has now brought our adult children into this mess by trying to make them pick sides in this ongoing fight, but the kids know she has a problem! I have brought up rehab several times, but she dismisses the idea and claims she doesnâ€™t need it. This past year, I got her an appointment with a therapist. It was just online, through videoconference, and my wife completely blew it off, barely paying attention to the therapist. After 25 years of marriage, Iâ€™m about ready to file for divorce. Help! -- Tired of Motherâ€™s Little Helper
Dear Tired: Of course youâ€™re exhausted. Youâ€™re living in the tides of addiction, but you donâ€™t have to be subject to the constant push and pull. To find some grounding, I strongly encourage you to check out Nar-Anon ( https://www.nar-anon.org ) or SMART Recovery Family and Friends ( https://www.smartrecovery.org/family ). You cannot neglect your own mental health.
As for your wife, she clearly has a severe opioid addiction and needs professional help. You and your adult children may choose to do an intervention in order to make the strongest possible case to get her into an in-patient treatment facility. She will need the supervision of medical professionals if sheâ€™s going to detox. Call the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration at 800-662-4357 for guidance and to be referred to resources in your area.
Send your questions for Annie Lane to dearannie@creators.com .
More from MLive Dear Abby: Should we tell our neighbors their dog barks all day? author: Tanvi Joshi
title: The Bat Trang Pottery Museumâ€™s Architectural Ode to Tradition Is A Canyon In The City Of Vietnam
text:
In the heart of Vietnamâ€™s Bat Trang village, where the artistry of ceramic and pottery has thrived since the 11th century, a striking testament to this enduring legacy has emerged. The Bat Trang Pottery Museum stands not only as a repository of artisanal creations but also as a living embodiment of the villageâ€™s rich history and cultural identity.
Designer: 1+1>2 Architects
The design of the Bat Trang Pottery Museum is more than just a structure; it is a poetic translation of local tales and traditions. The architects embarked on a collaborative journey with pottery experts, local artisans, and villagers, ensuring that the museumâ€™s essence resonates with the very soul of Bat Trang. The tiered, canyon-like architecture pays homage to the pottersâ€™ wheels, capturing the spirit of traditional kilns crafted from brick. This deliberate nod to the villageâ€™s heritage reflects a commitment to preserving and celebrating the art form that has been passed down through generations.
Walking through the Bat Trang Pottery Museum is not merely a visual experience; it is a journey through architectural drama. The seven inverted domes create a mesmerizing interplay of light and shadow, forming expansive open-air spaces on the ground level. These spaces become dynamic venues for events, exhibitions, and traditional festivals, fostering a sense of community engagement. Skylights strategically positioned atop the structure usher in daylight, infusing the interiors with ambient coolness and creating a harmonious connection with the surrounding environment, also marked as a sustainable element.
The choice of materials in the museumâ€™s construction is a delicate dance between tradition and modernity. Fiber-reinforced concrete cladding, chosen as the primary construction element, speaks to the contemporary while remaining grounded in practicality. Its lightness allows for upward expansion and easy implementation by local builders. Intertwined with this modern material are earthen bricks, mosaic ceramic, and pottery tilesâ€”each telling a story of the Bat Trang craft village. This thoughtful integration not only pays homage to the local craftsmanship but also ensures a seamless blend of the museum with its cultural context.
Beyond its role as a repository of ceramics and pottery, the Museum serves as a multifunctional haven for the community. The four-story tower accommodates commercial enterprises and homestays, ensuring economic support for the locals. The Bat Trang culinary space on the fourth floor celebrates the villageâ€™s gastronomic heritage, complemented by an adjacent auditorium for performing arts. At the summit, a rooftop garden crowns the museumâ€”a collaborative workshop and playground, inviting visitors to engage in the artistic process.
In capturing the essence of Bat Trangâ€™s local ceramic and porcelain crafts, the Bat Trang Pottery Museum stands as a beacon of cultural continuity. It is a testament to the delicate balance between architectural innovation and the preservation of tradition, offering visitors an immersive experience that transcends time and tells the story of a village deeply rooted in the art of pottery. Architectural photographer Trieu Chienâ€™s lens captures the sculptural beauty, inviting the world to witness the harmonious marriage of past and present in this unique architectural masterpiece.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Thursday Outlook: After the rain comes the cold in Charlotte
text:
By Ted Phaeton ,
13 hours ago
CHARLOTTE (QUEEN CITY NEWS) â€“ BRRR! After the rain comes the cold!
We are much colder this morning with a 30-degree gap between yesterday morning and today. The difference in temperatures match the current temperatures that weâ€™re feeling as the low 30s and upper 20s take hold.
Click here to see our latest Pinpoint Weather forecast! ðŸŒ¤ï¸ðŸŒ¦ï¸ Winds are still breezy in our higher elevations making for single-digit wind chills in our mountain counties. Bundle up this morning as a cold start will lead to a cool finish with highs aimed for the low 50s and upper 40s. Look for the mountains to peak in the 30s for this afternoon which will keep us cold for most of the day.
Tonight will be frigid yet again as lows dip into the 20s from our mountains to uptown heading into Friday. Clouds will build heading into the weekend with Friday peaking in the low 50s to end the work week.
This weekend will be cool and cloudy with Saturday hitting the mid-50s and winds picking up a bit out of the northeast. Sunday will only hit the upper 40s as spotty showers finish off the weekend.
60s will return on Monday with intermittent rain chances lingering for the start of the work week. 50s and sunshine move back in by mid-week for Wednesday.
Today: Mostly Clear & Cool. High: 51.
Tonight: Clear & Cold. Low: 29.

text:

Los partes mÃ©dicos difundidos explicaron que el cuadro clÃ­nico del papa es â€œcomplejoâ€, por lo que se alargarÃ¡ su hospitalizaciÃ³n en el PoliclÃ­nico Gemelli de Roma, donde estÃ¡ ingresado por â€œuna infecciÃ³n polimicrobiana del tracto respiratorioâ€, que obligÃ³ a cambiarle la terapia que recibe.
A pesar de su hospitalizaciÃ³n, Francisco volviÃ³ anoche a hablar con la parroquia de la Sagrada Familia, la Ãºnica iglesia catÃ³lica de Gaza, explicÃ³ a los medios italianos su pÃ¡rroco, el sacerdote argentino Gabriel Romanelli.
Por el momento, sÃ³lo ha trascendido que el pontÃ­fice ha pasado tranquilo su cuarta noche en el Gemelli y en la jornada de hoy se espera una actualizaciÃ³n del informe sobre sus condiciones de salud y sobre si estÃ¡ funcionando el tratamiento.
â€œEl Santo Padre continÃºa sin fiebre y con el tratamiento prescrito. Las condiciones clÃ­nicas son establesâ€, se indicÃ³ en el Ãºltimo comunicado emitido el lunes por la tarde Santa Sede sobre el estado de salud del pontÃ­fice, de 88 aÃ±os.
Previamente, el Vaticano habÃ­a explicado que las Ãºltimas pruebas realizadas mostraban â€œuna infecciÃ³n polimicrobiana del tracto respiratorio que ha obligado a modificar aÃºn mÃ¡s la terapiaâ€ de Francisco, cuyo tratamiento ya habÃ­a sido modificado el sÃ¡bado, despuÃ©s de los primeros exÃ¡menes.
El Vaticano aÃ±adiÃ³ que el â€œcuadro clÃ­nico complejo requerirÃ¡ de una hospitalizaciÃ³n adecuadaâ€, lo que hace prever que el papa permanecerÃ¡ varios dÃ­as en el hospital y que probablemente se pierda algunos de los mÃºltiples actos del AÃ±o Santo, como ya ha sucedido con el de este lunes por el Jubileo de los artistas en los estudios de CinecittÃ  o el Jubileo de los diÃ¡conos de este fin de semana.
